swp_compiler_ss13.common.ast

Interface AST

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ASTImpl

    public interface AST
    The abstract syntax tree (AST).
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    "Frank Zechert"

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<ASTNode> getDFSLTRIterator()
      Gets an iterator for this AST.
      java.lang.Integer getNumberOfNodes()
      Get the number of nodes the complete tree contains.
      BlockNode getRootNode()
      Returns the root node of the AST.
      SymbolTable getRootSymbolTable()
      Get the symbol table associated with the complete program.
      void setRootNode(BlockNode rootNode)
      Set the root node of the AST.

    • Method Detail

      • getRootNode

        BlockNode getRootNode()
        Returns the root node of the AST. The root node is always a BlockNode for correct ASTs.
        Returns:
        the root node of the AST.

      • setRootNode

        void setRootNode(BlockNode rootNode)
        Set the root node of the AST.
        Parameters:
        rootNode - The root node.

      • getNumberOfNodes

        java.lang.Integer getNumberOfNodes()
        Get the number of nodes the complete tree contains.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in this AST.

      • getDFSLTRIterator

        java.util.Iterator<ASTNode> getDFSLTRIterator()
        Gets an iterator for this AST. The iterator will traverse the tree in Depth First Search from Left to Right (DFSLTR).
        Returns:
        the DFSLTR iterator for this tree.

      • getRootSymbolTable

        SymbolTable getRootSymbolTable()
        Get the symbol table associated with the complete program. This is the symbol table that contains all program scopes. The symbol table returned is most likely the symbol table of the root node.
        Returns:
        The root symbol table.
